fields.description:
We have some error when we want to update the path of the log for cvs module. For uknown reason it has been working for an update or two and stop to work after it raised this error.
Now we are not able to update anything for cvs concern unless we stop the server and erase the cvslog.write.lock.

2005-06-14 17:40:34,140 ERROR [atlassian.jira.vcs.DefaultRepositoryManager] Error occurred while updating repository 'BNPPA_Tarification_Tool_A2A': Could not obtain lock 'D:\JIRA-INT\bnppa-atlassian-jira\bin\logs\cvslog.write.lock' in 10000 msecs.
com.atlassian.jira.util.LockException: Could not obtain lock 'D:\JIRA-INT\bnppa-atlassian-jira\bin\logs\cvslog.write.lock' in 10000 msecs.

fields.description:
The Bugzilla importer prints errors like:

2005-07-01 18:12:54,067 ERROR [atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean] Could not find fix_version TestProj:1.6 to associate with issue null
2005-07-01 18:12:54,067 ERROR [atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean] Could not find fix_version TestProj:1.6 to associate with issue null

These error messages are incorrect and misleading - there is nothing wrong in this situation, where an issue doesn't have a target milestone (fixfor version).
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer prints bogus errors

fields.description:
Currently the time picker always defaults to 12 hour format. To enable 24 hour format one needs to edit:
secure/popups/calendar.jsp

and change line 46 from:
timeFormat   : "12"

to:
timeFormat   : "24"

If the change is not picked up one might have to stop JIRA remove the contents of the application server's work directory and restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Automatically detect 12 or 24 hour time format for the date time picker field

fields.description: The predefined search link in the In Progress portlet shows all open (unresolved) issues, not just those "in progress". The actual portlet contents is correct though.  When compared to version 3.1.1 Pro the URL is lacking the &statusIds=3 (In Progress) parameter.
fields.summary: Link from In Progress portlet shows more than just In Progress issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7211].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It looks like the feature to display an issue key in strikethrough depends on the issue having been resolved.
This improvement request is to
* add a system parameter:
** Show Keys as strike-through: (x) Never, (/) If Resolved (i.e. Resolution not empty) (x) Based on Status
* add a new field to the Status screen (show issues in this status as strikethrough) that is enabled if the system parameter "Based on Status" is selected.

For example, the end result of a development ticket is status "Closed" - even though "Resolved" has a resolution set, it isn't considered done yet until verified by QA. The end result of a support ticket is "Answered". So, in the status maintenance screen, the statuses "Answered" and "Closed" would be flagged to show the issue in strikethrough font.

This enables people who hate the feature entirely the ability to turn it off; it enables people who like the current functionality to leave it as is, and it allows people to control when the issue is displayed as strikethrough based on status.

{quote}
Original issue description: show strike through for closed, rather than resolved issues.  Our users are confusing struckthrough issues as closed, and I was wondering if it would be possible to make this feature work only once an issue has been closed, not resolved. Because resolved means it hasn't been tested yet. From an implementation point of view, obviously this would have to be configurable to support current usage.
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow configuration of when issue keys are shown in strike-through font

fields.description:
i am a guest User of Jira.
where I am able to change/mange the the links between the issues which shouldn't be there, as if its I will be able to delete the important links as I had already done with the issues JRA-5164 and JRA-5844 (both were inter linked) which may cause problem i tracking the related isuues.

this is a serious BUG.

Anant Anand Gupta
fields.summary: Ability to manage links between issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7208].
  {panel}

i have found it useful to have a printout of a report that displays all outstanding issues in a table format.  JIRA currently (version 3.2.2) includes _some_ of the data associated with an issue, but does not display an issue's comments.  What i envision is adding another column to the "Issue Navigator".  This column contains all of the comments of this current issue.  (The description would also be displayed.)

yes, this might very well generate a very long (and potentially wide) report.  the value in such a report is that the printout can be taken to a meeting and an intelligent discussion about all issues can be had.  currently, the printout does not provide the comments, so unless everyone in the meeting room has access to a computer, it is not easy to discuss the details of the issues.

potential solutions would include the possibility of displaying the results of a filter via a choice of views.

this is similar to this issue: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-564  what is different is that i am looking for a tabular layout (to shorten the print out) instead of a listing as detailed in the issue body.

-markus
fields.summary: printout summary table displaying all comments
Add Slovak translation

fields.description:
JIRA apparently has a hot key for Alt-B.  This conflicts with Firefox's hotkey for the bookmark's menu.  There should be one of the following
1) Change the hot key to something else
2) A way to change/customize the hotkeys
3) Automatically change the hotkey to something else by detecting that the browser is firefox

Soap: addComponent()

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7201].
  {panel}

go to http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/

log out if automatic login is active

return to the home page
use the quick search box on the home page 
type in a 3-4 digit number (possible issue key) for example '567'

you get a single result : 

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/567
which is an error page
the URL is built without a project key 

This doesn't occur as soon as you click on 'browse project' in the navigation bar (then, a default current project seems to be defined and used in building the URL)

Limitation of the quick search on issue keys not going accross projects ??
fields.summary: Quick search for a number should search across multiple projects

fields.description:
New strategy for assigning user to issues.
1. Given defined version can have associated "default assingee" 
2. If this associated assignee is empty value -- JIRA works as it happens now
3. If it has associated valid assignee -- it takes precedence over component leader (and project leader too); user associated with version is assigned to issue.

This strategy is useful in situation when JIRA's "project" is treated as whole system and "version" is corelated with subproject modifying several components of system -- then according to policy first responsibility should be given to subproject (version) leader.

Implementation seems to be simple to some degree and can be done as wokflow plugin. Unfortunatelly storing association data requires change in domain (and DB) model, some forms and validations -- non-plugin-only enhancements are less "orthogonal" to vendor releases increasing cost of update to newer JIRA version.

cheers,
andy
fields.summary: Leader / assignee for version.
lower case issue keys not displaying as link in issue (description, comments, etc.)

fields.description:
I'm impressed by JIRA.  I have a suggestion that stems from the following question:  How does one decide which issues to work on first?  If one sorts by Prioirty, the highest priority will sort to the top.  However, the highest prioirty issue came from a client worth $10,000/year.  I have other lower priority issues that came from my largest client, worth $100,000/year.  Which issues should I address first?  From an internal standpoint I'm going to address the issues that have the most value to me as a company.  Also, if I always have outstanding High priority issues, I may never get to the trivial issues.  A trivial issue may be a mis-spelling on a screen.  Easy to fix, doesn't affect business logic, but very embarassing for the company.  Shouldn't it be fixed soon?

The Priority field should be reserved for internal use only and is set by business case.  The values JIRA currently uses for Priority should actually be in a Severity field.  The Severity never changes over the life of an issue.  It is non-negotiable.  Priority is negotiable and may change over the life of the issue.  Low Severity issues may initially be assigned a low priority.  Over time, the priority increases so the issue will eventually be addressed.  It still remains a Low Severity issue though.  As a manager, one can see a list of all the issues for one's department and adjust priorities so that issues will be resolved in the order that most affects the viability of the department, and thus the company.  Developers simply work from the top of the list.  It makes it easy for everyone involved to understand what needs fixing first and who's working on what...

I'm sure it would be possible to add this as a user-defined field.  However, I feel this needs to be an integral part of the application and treated as a first-class field for sorting, reporting, and display.
fields.summary: Rename the Priority field to Severity and create a new Priority Field

fields.description:
USE CASE:
Release a version with some still open issues.
Select to move open issues to the next version.

PROBLEM:
In the affected issues' change histories, this change in "Fix Version/s" is not logged.

NOTE:
When using bulk edit to change the "Fix Version/s", the change history of the edited files is updated correctly.
fields.summary: Releasing a version and moving open issues to the next version is not logged in affected issues' change history

fields.description:
I played around on the test project.

1. Added an issue
2. Added two subtasks
3. Edited one of the subtasks (e.g. changed estimate)
4. Updated

When I went back to the original issue (in #1) it displayed the issue striked out and showed as if half of the tasks were completed.

See test project, issue TST-2973.

Maybe it is due to configuration of the test project. If it is then please fix the test project so it will be possible to experiment with it.
fields.summary: When editing a subtask after it was added - it is displayed as strikethrough (completed?)

fields.description:
It would be nice if there were some 'User' type workflow events that could be coopted into use by custom workflows.

Our workflow contains extra steps for 'In Validation'. We need to send a custom message when validation commences and ends, at the moment this either involves adding a new workflow listener to send the notification, or hacking the source to add the extra events. 

If you added some extra event types 'User 1', 'User 2', 'User 3' and 'User 4', then it would be straightforward to customize these as desired, you'd just have to modify the notification templates and the resource files so the message topic and body would get set appropriatly.

I've already added some extra event types, but they're of my own type rather than 'User'. I'll have to make the same changes now for 3.2.2, so I'll do in in the general way and attach a patch.
fields.summary: Add 'user' notification events.

fields.description: The transitions we created between steps in a custom workflow disappear after restarting Tomcat.
fields.summary: Workflow transitions disappear

fields.description:
I created a filter, then used it in a "statistics" item in my portlet.

The link on the portlet page for one of the projects that gets reported is:
http://jira.myhost.com/secure/${urlPrefix}&pid=10061

But, it *should* be: 
http://jira.myhost.com/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10061
fields.summary: Statistics item on portlet page has wrong link

fields.description:
Form Errors:

    * Failed to import data: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport@18f729c, result: error Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot deactivate indexing as it is not currently active.



This error message appears when importing a backup.  Indexing failures are harmless, as they can easily be corrected.  The message is also incorrect- the data imported correctly!  I recreated the index in the newly created directory (and attachments dir as well) and everything worked.
fields.summary: Indexing fails needlessly on DB import

"This issue"
fields.summary: hardcoded text not in *.properties

fields.description:
We are now considering adding version management to a project. A user has this question: What if a fix has been slated for multiple versions, but the developer has only fixed it in one version so far? There is no way to mark the issue as resolved for one version but not the other. Maybe you can help explain how this workflow would be handled within JIRA.
Thanks
fields.summary: how to resolve issues fixed in only 1 version

fields.description:
When creating issues or comments from emails and having the 'reporter' being notified, if messages bounce they can be added as commets, which generate notifications which generate bounces. This puts JIRA into a loop.

Note that JIRA does add "Precedence" header with value "bulk", which stops some mail servers from sending bounce messages back. However, it does not always work.
fields.summary: Detect bounced emails
The sub-tasks link to parent issue is created by a web action after the Issue Created event has been fired

fields.description:
Ths current cascading select lists uses a lot of fairly obtuse and difficult to understand javascript code. We should look to upgrade to neater code as per

http://www.bobbyvandersluis.com/articles/unobtrusivedynamicselect.php
fields.summary: Cascading Select list code improvements

fields.description: oscore-2.2.5 needs to be officially release and included in the next release version of Jira so that we can take advanatage of some bug fixes within oscore.
fields.summary: Release oscore-2.2.5

fields.description:
The workflow integrity check for the currentstep needs to be reinstated in the workflow activation check and the intergrity checker itself. 

The integrity check needs to determine if the current status has any further available steps - if so, it should look at the current step. If the current status is final - i.e. the issue cannot be moved to any other status - the integrity check should not look at the current step as it has been removed.

This logic needs to be in place for the workflow activation check and the integrity check itself.
fields.summary: Workflow integrity check for CurrentStep needs to be improved.

fields.description:
The project deletion fails with:
Exception removing project: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.project.ProjectDelete@6314624c, result: null

The problem is that the permissions override parameter is not passed for sub-task deletion when issues are deleted.

As a workaround, please grant the Delete Issues permission to the admin user who is deleteing the project, and then remove the project.
fields.summary: Deleteing projects with existing sub-task issues fails when the admin user deleting the project dos not have permissions to delete issues in the project

fields.description:
Improve CSV import for multiple values

Importing into fields with mutliple values is fairly rough at the moment. eg. for multiple versions, you need to give each version column a different name before it will import successfully
fields.summary: Improve CSV import for multiple values (component, version)

fields.description:
An option should be available that would tell JIRA to attempt authentication using a lowercased version of the entered username.Our users are not used to case sensitive usernames and this has caused issues. We are using LDAP authentication and we cannot modify our LDAP to obtain case insensitivity.

If this is possible already, through some configuration of osuser, then it should be documented.
fields.summary: Should allow case insensitive usernames

fields.description: The progress bars for the 3.3 Enterprise and 3.3 Pro releases are wrong, because they show the progress of the 3.3 release.
fields.summary: Progress bar wrong in Roap Map

fields.description: As an administrator, I have access to the "Field Configuration Scheme" and "Issue Type Screen Scheme" actions, so it makes sense for the options "select scheme | edit field configurations" and "select scheme | edit scheme" to be available. However, for a user who is not a member of "jira-administrators", but does have permission to administer the project, those links should not show up. When clicking on them, a login page appears. For the other fields (those not new to 3.2),  the edit links are correctly suppressed.
fields.summary: unavailable actions show as available on project admin

fields.description: ddddd
fields.summary: helllo testing stufff

fields.description: I am trying to fill in a custom field in sub task with information of parent issue. I have defined a listener to do that. In issueCreated()-method I fetch newly created issue from database and that works fine, but fetched issue object's getParent()-method returns always null. Afterwards when editing that same subtask  listener's issueUpdated()-method is called and then getParent()-method returns parent issue correctly
fields.summary: SubTask doesn't know it's parent in listener issueCreated()-method

fields.description:
Cannot clear update issue field post workflow function

If you have a value set (say for Resolution) setting the value back to none will not work (valuer will be ignored)

Editing:
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.workflow.UpdateIssueFieldFunctionPluginFactory:getDescriptorParams
to set the value when string is empty will fix it.

For a workaround, delete the function and add a new one with a blank value
fields.summary: Cannot clear update issue field post workflow function
SLA tracking for each issue type

fields.description:
SOAP updateGroup is not working

The code for updating the groups are there but it doesn't update the users properly...
fields.summary: SOAP updateGroup is not working

fields.description: The "Clone issue" page shows an "x" character in the top left corner.
fields.summary: Clone issue page has funny "x" character

fields.description:
I have translated the issue types, priorities, resolutions, and statuses using the "translate issue types" etc. feature in JIRA 3.2, which worked.

When I import the JIRA 3.2 data into 3.2.2, all translations are no longer accessible from the administrator dialogs.

In addition, in the "issue type translation" page it is no longer possible to view a different locale. The dropdown menu always changes back to the first setting (chinese) after clicking the "view" button.

I think this feature is unuseable in 3.2.2, with no workaround.
fields.summary: issue type translation broken

fields.description:
As the issue navigator has been refactored and does not hit the database for many issues, the need for issue cache is greatly reduced. The issue cache also is one of the main sources of memory consumptionin JIRA, especially if issues have long descriptsions and if Oracle 10g drivers are used (as they seem to allocate strings in 32K buffers at all times).

It appears that as the get() method of the UtilCache (used by the issue cache) is not synchronised but manipulates the underlying collections to provide LRU functionality. As the underlying collections are not synchronised a race condition could occur.

Removing the issue cache should help avoid all these problems and will not decrease JIRA's performance.
fields.summary: Remove issue cache

fields.description: In Jira 3.2.x the clone issue is now copying across the Original Estimate, Remaining Estimate, Time Spent fields and it should not.
fields.summary: Clone issue should not clone the Original Estimate, Remaining Estimate, and Time Spent fields

fields.description:
Allow refreshing of custom field cache through SOAP

For people who add options & other configurations directly through the dB. This should be quite trivial to implement and quite useful
fields.summary: Allow refreshing of custom field cache through SOAP

fields.description: Attached are files including the new field-type for mssql and another file with some indexes to take advantage of the new field types. These files were submitted by Michael Thorpe. The delta file is a file that will convert an existing mssql db.
fields.summary: Update mssql field type mappings to utilize nvarchar

fields.description:
after import a zipped xml file from jira 3.2.1 to jira 3.2.2 on oracle 9.2 db and the attach path correctly configured. After reindex (with reindex path correcly configured) the issue comments are lost.
Jira issue has the comment entrance but no data on it.
fields.summary: comments lost after an import

fields.description:
I have a jira with many data and some projects with customs active workflows. I had exported to .xml (zip) file with no errors.
If i want to import this xml to the same version of jira but on oracle's 9.2 db a get an exception.
fields.summary: Importing an .xml from qsql to oracle
Make Resolution field optional

fields.description:
How do I find issues where a field is null.
The field could either be checkbox, date or text. I need to produce a report where users have not entered a value for these fields.

What should the criteria in this field be ?
fields.summary: Find Issues - creating an accurate selection criteria

fields.description: Whenever I try to create a project with a key like "JP2" I get an error indicating that I can't use numbers - this is a major deficiency.  It is a major issue in the defence industry when projects are often given codenames with lots of numbers.
fields.summary: Can't create project with key of alphanumerics

fields.description: There seems to be a bug in sorting. I used the updated recently filter and sorting was not entirely ok . See screenshot.The last updates to these two Issue were made by linking.
fields.summary: Broken Sorting for Updated

fields.description:
Comments on linking issues should only appear on the issue the link was created on

This changes how JIRA works currently but I think it's worth while. When you comment on a link, you really only ever want the comment to appear on the issue that you're creating the link from. eg the comment 

This issue has been documented at JRA-5225. Comment and vote on this issue if you wish. 

Will makes sense for issues that was linked to JRA-5225, but really makes no sense in 5225 itself.
fields.summary: Comments on linking issues should only appear on the issue the link was created on

fields.description: If importing more than one Product from Bugzilla then it is possible to give the JIRA projects for these products the same key, which results in projects with the same key.
fields.summary: Buzilla importer does not detect duplicate project keys

fields.description: We have converted the calendar.js files to ASCI for the languages that we ship with but not the other languages. We should just spend the time to create a script so that we can do this easily.
fields.summary: All the calendar.js files need to be converted to ASCI
When moving issue and the mover has Modify Permission leave the old reporter as the default for the field

fields.description: It is not possible to set a default value for a 'Read Only Custom Field' through UI.
fields.summary: Not possible to set default value for Read Only Custom Field through UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7150].
  {panel}

When I try to create a subtask, the first screen that I am presented with reads:

"Step 1 of 2: Choose the issue type...
  Issue Type: Sub-task"

The form only has 1 select box for the Issue Type, and the only possible value in the box is "Sub-task".  Why would you ever even present this screen?  There is nothing to do.
fields.summary: Unnecessary screen when creating a subtask

fields.description:
users:
- baha / baha is a member of the user group BSM 
- kran / kran is a member of the user group PPC

1) login as kran / kran
2) create new product request in test project 
3) select workflow action "Ready for BSM Review"
4) logout
5) login as baha / baha
6) find the issue that was created by kran
7) select workflow action "Take Ownership"
8) assign the issue to Bacher Harald
9) select workflow action "BSM Approved"

now have a look at the workflow actions displayed:
- when logged in as baha, you see "Resolve"
- when logged in as kran you see "Take Ownership"

the other two workflow actions defined as transitions in ProductRequest_Workflow 
are missing: BSM Clarification Needed, Specs (MRS) Needed

on both transitions there is the following condition which obviously doesn't work !!!

Only users in group BSM can execute this transition
AND
Only users in group PPC can execute this transition


the log file doesn't show anything interesting except for the fact
that I forgot to fill in required fields when creating the product
request (see attachment)
fields.summary: 2 CONDITIONS regarding USER GROUP on workflow transitions don't work

fields.description:
If a user sets his notification preference to be HTML mails, no notifications ever reach him.
If they change the setting to TEXT mail, all notifications arrive correctly.

I tested sending an HTML email from the "Send Test Email" from the Mail Servers page and this worked fine.

There are no errors in any logs or in standard out.
fields.summary: Users with a preference for HTML email are not receiving email notifications

fields.description:
When we are using french setting in preference profil and want to export all fields in excell format accentued character are not correctly encoded.
It does working well for the current field option link.
See the attached file.
fields.summary: Incorect Data encoding in export excell

fields.description:
Hi there,
every 2 days Jira stops with the message: see attachment
Do we use the srong java version?
Thanks for help
fields.summary: Problem with JVM

fields.description:
Microsoft's Win32 API maximum file path length (MAX_PATH = 260
characters; see
http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/fileio/fs/naming_a_file.asp). This is confirmed by the fact that if I extract
your ZIP file to my root drive (I:\) everything goes just fine.

The longest path in your ZIP file is 186 characters long:
"atlassian-jira-professional-3.2.1-standalone\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\cla
sses\com\atlassian\jira\web\action\admin\issuefields\screens\ConfigureFi
eldScreenScheme$DefaultIssueOperation.class". This means that you cannot
extract the ZIP file to a destination path that exceeds 74 characters
(260 - 186 = 74). I got the error when I wanted to extract it to a new
folder on my desktop. The total length of the path of that folder was 87
characters, which was too long.
fields.summary: Can't unzip jira into directory with a long path name

fields.description: To configure LDAP authentification is pretty simple: it is only 5 -- 8 properties. It could be nice to configure LDAP in Administration web interface.
fields.summary: Configuration of LDAP authentification in Administration web interface.

fields.description: If jira is configured to use Ldap authentification and user change its password, Jira checks current password in ldap, but modify password in local database only. I think, the correct behaviour is to change both passwords -- in ldap, because this is the one which is realy used, and in local database due to authentification fallback into database password, when ldap is disabled in jira configuration.
fields.summary: "Change password" facility modify only a password in a local database, not in LDAP.

fields.description:
If a password stored in LDAP is externaly changed during a jira session, jira use old value, when user change his password. 

How to reproduce:

1) Set password in LDAP to value "a".

2) Set up jira to use LDAP. 

3) Log into jira using password "a".

4) Externaly modify password in LDAP to value "b". 

5) Try to change password in jira with current password "b". This fails. 

6) Try to change password in jira with current password "a". This successed. 

I thing this is wrong, when we consider ldap as "external user management system".
fields.summary: LDAP password is cached during session.

fields.description: if you enter a compound time like "1h30m" (no space) in the "Time Spent" field on the Log Work form, then the 30m _is not_ included - only 1h is logged. If you have a space "1h 30m" the 30m  _is_ included - a total of 90m is logged.
fields.summary: No space in inhomogenous time spent causes truncation

fields.description:
Throws an error when you try to delete an issue when you have no attachments directory set.
From support request: JSP-1861
fields.summary: Can not delete an issue when attachments directory has not been set

fields.description:
This is due to the fact that comments are stored in a separate index.

If the filter does not search through comments the results will be correct.
fields.summary: Statistics are wrong when using a filter that searches through comments

fields.description:
Jira and CVS integration can create large files when repositories have many commits. One idea might be to use "cvs log -N" to not display the tags for each version, instead of the current "cvs log" command. The difference on our system is a file 1/6 of the size, a substantial difference. However, I do see lots of warnings from statcvs about revisions not having a main branch when I restart Jira.

Log sizes:

vent2, all tags:   53777181 Jun 22 14:47 vent2/cvs.log
vent2, no tags:     8933991 Jun 22 14:47 vent2/cvs2.log

My question is: are the tags in CVS log files actually used by statcvs and Jira?

~Matt
fields.summary: Can cvs.log files be made smaller?
Issue List does not differentiate issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7133].
  {panel}

When I do a time tracking report, it would be great if the issues were directly editable in that issue navigator view.

i.e.

key | status | priority| summary   |  original estimate | estimated time remaining | Time Spent | Accuracy
a-12 open   3             blah               2d                              2d*                                             unknown*     unknown
a-13 open   3             blah               2d                              2d*                                             unknown*     unknown

We would like to directly edit the fields with a *, without having to select each issue, then edit the issue, then log work done, then type in the amount of work done an select the "set remaining time".  It's too cumbersome.

Better workflow: have the fields be directly editable.  

We do this every day, and it's very very painful.  If I had the choice to use something different, I would -> that's how painful it is.
fields.summary: Allow issue editing in the issue navigator

fields.description:
This is trivial, but annoying... Jira keeps dumping "!" characters (with a nice newline at the end) while running. Is this some left-over debugging code? :-D

Anyhow, in the last 20 minutes, with only me working on Jira I had 76156 of those... I bet that our system can generate few megabytes of "!\n" a day!
fields.summary: Extra "!" characters on standard output (or error?)
Add methods of health montioring for JIRA service

fields.description:
When downloading an attachement with spaces in the file name is truncated to the first space in the file name.

Some people have reported this a bug against Firefox, however they have said that they won't fix it as it happens when one does "not properly escape the spaces in the HTTP headers it sends...". See: 
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=252309
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=221028
fields.summary: Attachcments with spaces in the filename get truncated when downloading in Firefox

fields.summary: Deleing a filter caused an error

fields.description:
If JIRA is forcefully taken down, e.g. power interruption, while updating CVS log, the CVS integration will fail on restart with the message "An unknown error occurred - actions == null." in the Version Control tab of the issue detail page, and with an error in the log.  It would be great if the VcsService would clean up locks on startup, and certainly the error message should be improved.

2005-06-23 10:26:49,020 ERROR [atlassian.jira.vcs.DefaultRepositoryManager] Error occurred while updating repository 'ris': Could not obtain lock 'C:\jira\cvs\cvslog.write.lock' in 10000 msecs.
com.atlassian.jira.util.LockException: Could not obtain lock 'C:\jira\cvs\cvslog.write.lock' in 10000 msecs.
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.updateCvs(CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.java:246)
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.updateCvs(CvsRepository.java:204)
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.updateRepository(CvsRepository.java:295)
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.DefaultRepositoryManager.updateRepository(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:489)
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.DefaultRepositoryManager.updateRepositories(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:445)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.vcs.VcsService.run(VcsService.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:50)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
fields.summary: JIRA should remove CVS lock file on startup

fields.description: I tried to access JIRA while a (manual) re-index was taking place. After a short delay, I was presented with a screen telling me that a re-index was taking place and that it was 2134587798% complete. Actually some number like that - I didn't write it down, and I don't know how to get a screenshot on a MAC.
fields.summary: incorrect percentage shown to user during re-index

fields.description:
When navigating the atlassian demo and support sites I needed to register independently for all the above sites. A much improved user story is to provide a single sign-on that is valid for ALL the atlassian sites. As a potential customer for JIRA and Confluence, I am hoping that I can provide the same for my users - where a single registration, userid can be used across JIRA and Confluence apps seamlessly.

I am not sure if  the the JIRA project in the Atlassian JIRA or OSUser in the OpenSymphony JIRA is the right place to report this...
fields.summary: single sign-in (not sure if JIRA is the right project)

fields.description:
Hello, it would be great to have a possibility to share the "Release-Version" between Projects.

Currently we have a Situation, where Bugfixies from different Projects/Systems are fixed/delivered in a certain (same) Release:
- in order to keep a Overview of a Release-Status, we have to "manage" the SAME Release-Information in ALL "Projects" and while
retirieving Information of a ongoing Release we have to examin the Release-Status of ALL the Projects to get a complete Overview of what's going on...

Greetings,

Alexander
fields.summary: Sharing Release-Version between Projects
When moving issues and the reporter is updated it is always displayed as Anonymous in the confirmation screen.

fields.description:
Greetings from Germany!

We need a possibilty to perform a "complete Assignee-History-Search" which would present us all the Issues a certain User was ever involved in:
- either as a "Assignee", a "Creator" or only a "Commenter" of a Issue.

At the Moment, the Issue Navigator can only find Issues of a certain User if he is/was a Creator of a Issue or is a current Assignee.
A Search for the User's Name in "Comments" (in order to locate his Involvement) doesn't deliver the wanted Results as well.
If a User was a Asignee of a certain Issue at the past, his "Involvement" cannot be found - to my Opinion, a Implementation of Possibilty to search the COMPLETE "Issue-History" per User is a crucial Feature JIRA must have.

Greetings,

Alexander
fields.summary: Implementation of a complete History-Search over the current and past Issues

fields.description:
From my logs:

2005-06-23 08:15:46,608 ERROR [velocity] Left side ( '' ) of addition operation has null value. Operation not possible. templates/jira/issue/field/priority-edit.vm [line 12, column 60]
2005-06-23 08:15:46,608 ERROR [velocity] RHS of #set statement is null. Context will not be modified. templates/jira/issue/field/priority-edit.vm [line 12, column 1]
2005-06-23 08:15:46,640 ERROR [velocity] Left side of addition operation is not a valid type. Currently only integers (1,2,3...) and Integer type is supported. templates/jira/issue/field/priority-edit.vm [line 12, column 55]

Probably this hides some functionality on the EditIssue page, and it is also flooding my logs with error messages.
fields.summary: Velocity errors in templates/jira/issue/field/priority-edit.vm

fields.description: Add the ability to rename Bugzilla Projects on import.
fields.summary: Rename Bugzilla Projects on import

fields.description:
The JIRA Docs discussing JIRA Portlets needs the following message added
to the end of the page:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/portlets_summary.html

<addition>
New portlets can be created by writing a Java class, a template and an XML
descriptor file, packaged as a JIRA plugin. See How To Create a JIRA Portlet
for more information.
</addition>

This also needs to be linked as seen here:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/extending.html
fields.summary: Update JIRA Portlets doc
Update entitymodel.xml for JIRA 3.2 in the docs for Firebird

fields.description:
Due to JRA-7112 adding conditions to the initial workflow action doe snot make much sense.

The editor needs to be fixed to reflect this.
fields.summary: Remove ability to add conditions to the initial workflow transition in the workflow editor.
Ensure JIRA respects conditions on the Create Issue initial workflow transition.
